page.title: 12LIFE IN AN OLD HOUSE
page.content: THE FARMHOUSE IS OVER 400 YEARS OLD.ELELCTRICITY WAS INSTALLED IN THE 1920'S FOR THE COST OF Â£15.00. AT THAT TIME NOT MANY HOUSES HAD ELECTRICITY NOT LONG AFTERWARDS THEY HAD WATER PIPED ACROSS THE FIELDS FROM ANOTHER FARM NEVERTHELESS THEY STILL HAD TO HEAT THE WATER TO WASH. BEFORE THE ELECTRICITY WAS INSTALLED THE FAMILY USED OIL LAMPS. NOW THE HOUSE HAS CENTRAL HEATING,PIPED HOT WATER AND AN INSIDE LAVATORY,AS WELL AS MODERN AMENITIES SUCH AS A TELEPHONE AND TELEVISION.THE FARMER'S WIFE HAS AN AGA- A COAL BURNING COOKER. THE FAMILY IN WINTER HAVE AN OPEN FIRE IN SOME ROOMS.LIFE IN AN OLD HOUSE NOW IS JUST LIKE LIVING IN A MODERN HOUSE AS IT HAS ALL THE SAME AMENITIES.
